intro: Hypochaeris lessingii, commonly known as the lesser hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and disturbed soils, and it produces yellow flowers with ray florets. Hypochaeris lessingii is often found in regions with temperate climates and is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions. Its botanical features make it a common sight in native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
